study_id: unique ID for each study - numeric/character
author: first author name - numeric/character
all_info_expected: expected input data leading to an effect size estimate - character
n_exp: number of participants in the exposed/experimental group - numeric
n_nexp: number of participants in the non-exposed/non-experimental group - numeric
n_cases: number of cases/events across exposed/non-exposed groups - numeric
n_controls: number of controls/no-event across exposed/non-exposed groups - numeric
reverse_2x2: whether the direction of the effect size generated from the contingency table should be flipped - logical
baseline_risk: proportion of cases/events in the non-exposed group - numeric
small_margin_prop: smallest margin proportion of cases/events in the underlying 2x2 table - numeric
n_cases_exp: number of cases/events in the exposed group - numeric
n_cases_nexp: number of cases/events in the non exposed group - numeric
n_controls_exp: number of controls/no-event in the exposed group - numeric
n_controls_nexp: number of controls/no-event in the non exposed group - numeric
reverse_prop: whether the direction of the cohen_d value should be flipped - logical
prop_cases_exp: proportion of cases/events in the exposed group (ranging from 0 to 1) - numeric
prop_cases_nexp: proportion of cases/events in the non-exposed group (ranging from 0 to 1) - numeric
reverse_chisq: whether the direction of the effect size generated from the chi-square value should be flipped - logical
reverse_chisq_pval: whether the direction of the effect size generated from the chi-square p-value should be flipped - logical
reverse_phi: whether the direction of the effect size generated from the phi value should be flipped - logical
reverse_or: whether the direction of the effect size generated from the odds ratio should be flipped - logical
logor_se: standard error of the log odds ratio - numeric
or_ci_lo: lower bound of the 95% CI of the risk ratio - numeric
or_ci_up: upper bound of the 95% CI of the log risk ratio - numeric
logor_ci_lo: lower bound of the 95% CI of the risk ratio - numeric
logor_ci_up: upper bound of the 95% CI of the log risk ratio - numeric
reverse_or_pval: whether the direction of the cohen_d value should be flipped - logical
or_pval: p-value of an odds ratio - numeric
reverse_rr: whether the direction of the effect size generated from the risk ratio should be flipped - logical
logrr_se: log risk ratio standard error - numeric
rr_ci_lo: lower bound of the 95% CI of the risk ratio - numeric
rr_ci_up: upper bound of the 95% CI of the risk ratio - numeric
logrr_ci_lo: lower bound of the 95% CI of the log risk ratio - numeric
logrr_ci_up: upper bound of the 95% CI of the log risk ratio - numeric
reverse_rr_pval: whether the direction of the risk ratio generated from a p-value should be flipped - logical
rr_pval: p-value of a risk ratio -  numeric
user_es_measure_crude: name of the (non-adjusted) effect size measure used - character
user_es_crude: value of an effect size - numeric
user_se_crude: standard error of the effect size - numeric
user_ci_lo_crude: lower bound of the 95% CI of the effect size measure - numeric
user_ci_up_crude: upper bound of the 95% CI of the effect size measure - numeric
user_es_measure_adj: name of the (adjusted) effect size measure used - character
user_es_adj: value of the adjusted effect size - numeric
user_se_adj: standard error of the effect size  - numeric
user_ci_lo_adj: adjusted lower bound of the 95% CI of the effect size measure - numeric
user_ci_up_adj: adjusted upper bound of the 95% CI of the effect size measure - numeric
